intro: Onosma assadii, commonly known as the Assad's hedge mustard, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, narrow leaves. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
